summary: The Basque Autonomous Community, also known as Euskadi, is a special region in northern Spain. It has its own government and laws, called the Statute of Autonomy. This community includes three provinces: Araba, Bizkaia, and Gipuzkoa. The city of Vitoria-Gasteiz is like its capital, as it's where important buildings like the Basque Parliament are located. Bilbao, another city, is the biggest in terms of people. The Basque Country is also a cultural region for the Basque people, who have their own language and traditions.
title: Basque Country (autonomous community)
